title: A Bear, a Boy and a Dog

sources.title: "A Bear, a Boy and a Dog" (1921)
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation   We have included this film in our program to illustrate the work and contributions of our star Nell Shipman. "A Bear, a Boy and a Dog" is a short drama, made from a story written by Nell Shipman.   Directed by                 Bert Van Tuyle Produced by               Nell Shipman Productions Inc. Written by                  Nell Shipman Starring                      Sunny Howard (the boy), Margaret Mann (the boy's mother) Cinematography        Joseph Walker Release date                September 11, 1921 Running time              22 minutes Country                        US Language                     Silent film, English intertitles   Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976: "Allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

metadata.Plot: A young boy goes on strike from his mother to protest his chores. On his break, he makes friends with a stray dog and a bear. His good will with the animals ends up saving the day once his mother returns.
metadata.Actors: Sonny Howard, Margaret Mann, Nell Shipman
